Call a $ 7$-digit telephone number $ d_1d_2d_3 - d_4d_5d_6d_7$ \textit{memorable} if the prefix sequence $ d_1d_2d_3$ is exactly the same as either of the sequences $ d_4d_5d_6$ or $ d_5d_6d_7$ (possibly both). Assuming that each $ d_i$ can be any of the ten decimal digits $ 0,1,2,\ldots9$, the number of different memorable telephone numbers is\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 19,\!810 \qquad \textbf{(B)}\ 19,\!910 \qquad \textbf{(C)}\ 19,\!990 \qquad \textbf{(D)}\ 20,\!000 \qquad \textbf{(E)}\ 20,\!100$
